Description: Fragment from rim of pottery mortarium with tall collar rim. Clay brown, porous, with vegetable inclusions (Egyptian marl clay). Holes for drilling sample in break. Graffito on outside of rim: ]νελ[.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 399)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 673, no. 317)
Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p. 55, Table 1, Nauk 18)
Villing 2006 / 'Drab Bowls' for Apollo: The Mortaria of Naukratis and Exchange in the Archaic Eastern Mediterranean (p.40 fig.23, p.41 no.17)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IA.37)

Spataro and Villing 2009 / Scientific investigation of pottery grinding bowls from the Archaic and Classical Eastern Mediterranean (p.91, fig.3, p.93, table.1, p.95, p.96, p.97, fig.8, p.97, fig.8) (N12)
